metadata.title: CVE-2024-36000 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:mm/hugetlb: fix missing hugetlb_lock for resv unchargeThere is a recent report on UFFDIO_COPY over hugetlb:https://lore.kernel.org/all/000000000000ee06de0616177560@google.com/350:	lockdep_assert_held(&hugetlb_lock);Should be an issue in hugetlb but triggered in an userfault context, whereit goes into the unlikely path where two threads modifying the resv maptogether.  Mike has a fix in that path for resv uncharge but it looks likethe locking criteria was overlooked: hugetlb_cgroup_uncharge_folio_rsvd()will update the cgroup pointer, so it requires to be called with the lockheld.
